content: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?>  <reference anchor='I-D.abarth-cookie'> <front> <title>HTTP State Management Mechanism</title>  <author initials='A' surname='Barth' fullname='Adam Barth'>     <organization /> </author>  <date month='December' day='30' year='2009' />  <abstract><t>This document defines the HTTP Cookie and Set-Cookie headers.  These headers can be used by HTTP servers to store state on HTTP user agents, letting the servers maintain a stateful session over the mostly stateless HTTP protocol.  The cookie protocol has many historical infelicities and should be avoided for new applications of HTTP.  NOTE: If you have suggestions for improving the draft, please send  email to http-state@ietf.org.  Suggestions with test cases are  especially appreciated.</t></abstract>  </front>  <seriesInfo name='Internet-Draft' value='draft-abarth-cookie-07' /> <format type='TXT'         target='http://www.ietf.org/internet-drafts/draft-abarth-cookie-07.txt' /> </reference>
